data.title: Auditions and Video Submissions for “The Wedding Singer” and “The Rocky Horror Show”
data.text:
Job Details

DESCRIPTION

!! UPDATED DATE AND TIME DUE TO SEVERE WEATHER !!

Auditions and Video Submissions for “The Wedding Singer” and “The Rocky Horror Show”

The Alhambra Theatre and Dining will host local auditions for “The Wedding Singer” and “The Rocky Horror Show” on Friday, August 9th, from 10:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Video submissions for both productions will also be considered at this audition. The Alhambra provides professional compensation, round-trip transportation, and excellent accommodation for up to 8 visiting artists per production.

“The Wedding Singer" is a musical with music by Matthew Sklar, lyrics by Chad Beguelin, and a book by Beguelin and Tim Herlihy. It is based on the 1998 film of the same name. The musical revolves around Robbie, who sings at weddings, his failed relationship with his former fiancée, and his romance with a new love, Julia.

Rehearsals Begin: Monday, September 23rd - Thursday,October 3rd, 2024

Previews Begin: Thursday, October 3rd, 2024

Opening Night: Friday, October 4th

Closing Performance: Sunday, November 10th, 2024

"The Rocky Horror Show" is a musical with music, lyrics, and book by Richard O'Brien. The musical tells the story of a newly engaged couple who get caught in a storm and seek refuge in the home of a mad transvestite scientist, Dr. Frank-N-Furter. There, they encounter his new creation, Rocky, a Frankenstein-style monster in the form of a physically perfect muscle man with blond hair and a tan, artificially made and fully grown.

This show has adult themes, is rated R, and is intended for audiences 18+. The cast will include actors from “The Wedding Singer” and actors who can provide local housing in the Jacksonville area.

Rehearsals Begin: Tuesday, October 8th - Thursday,October 17th, 2024

Previews Begin: Thursday, October 17th, 2024

Opening Night: Friday, October 18th

Closing Performance: Saturday, November 2nd, 2024

Audition Location: Alhambra Theatre and Dining, 12000 Beach Blvd, Jacksonville, FL 32246

Friday, August 9th

Times: 10:00am - 1:30pm (Vocal Auditions)

1:30pm - 3:30pm (Dance Auditions - Must attend vocal auditions)

Please prepare two contrasting vocal selections in the style of the show for which you are auditioning. Each selection should be no more than 32 bars. Please bring sheet music in your key. An accompanist will be provided.

Men: please wear sneakers or charter shoes if asked to stay for the dance call.

Females: Please wear character heels if asked to stay for the dance call.

“The Wedding Singer” Character Breakdown (All roles are available)

Director: Shain Stroff

Musical Director: Cathy Giddens Murphy

Choreographers: Erick Ariel Sureda

Robbie Hart: The lead singer of a band. Handsome and charismatic. A truly 'nice' guy with the classic lead singer aura and personality. Also a dreamer. He is in love with love until Linda leaves him at the altar and breaks his heart. Gender: Male Age: 25 to 35 Vocal range top: C6 bottom: B3

Sammy: The bass player in the wedding band and one of Robbie's best friends. He is a total guy's guy, but beneath his pretending to love being a bachelor, he is actually in love with Holly. Gender: Male Age: 25 to 35 Vocal range top: A5 bottom: C4

George: The wedding band's keyboardist and one of Robbie's best friends. Sensitive and somewhat flamboyant. The foil to Sammy's super guy attitude. Gender: Male Age: 25 to 35 Vocal range top: A5 bottom C4

Julia Sullivan: The pretty "girl next door" in looks and personality. Engaged to Glen but falls in love with Robbie and is conflicted about who to choose. Empathetic, caring, and brave. Gender: Female Age: 25 to 35 Vocal range top: F5 bottom: G3

Holly Sullivan: Julia's cousin, very uninhibited and forward with comedic timing. Sexually promiscuous and always up for a good time, but wants to be loved and is looking for romantic fulfillment in all the wrong places. She is in love with Sammy. Based on Madonna of the 80’s. Gender: Female Age: 25 to 35 Vocal range top: E5 bottom A3

Glen Gulia: Julia's fiancé. A Wall Street broker. He is rich, shallow, and materialistic. Constantly tries to buy Julia's love with money. He is a bit of a womanizer. Slimy Gender: Male Age: 30 to 50 Vocal range top: B5 bottom: D4

Rosie: Robbie's grandmother who raised him. Motherly but adventurous and consistently trying to remain "hip" despite her age. Comedic Timing. Can Rap. Gender: Female Age: 60 to 80 Vocal range top: C5 bottom: C4

Linda: Robbie's fiancé who leaves him at the altar. Keeps Robbie around as a backup plan. She is more in love with the idea of Robbie being a rock star than she is with Robbie. Trashy, oversexed. Pat Benatar type. Gender: Female Age: 20 to 35 Vocal range top: D5 bottom: A3

Male and Female Ensemble: The Ensemble will consist of high-energy, charismatic performers who must sing and dance well. The Ensemble will play various roles within the production. Select ensemble members will be cast as understudies for Robbie, Sammy, George, Julia, Linda, Glen, and Rosie.

“The Rocky Horror Show” Character Breakdown

Director: Shain Stroff

Musical Director: Cathy Giddens Murphy

Choreographers: Shain Stroff

Usherette/Magenta: Female, Age Flexible (Range: Mezzo-Soprano Belt, Bb3-Eb5) She opens the production singing “Science Fiction/Double Feature” with Usherette and phantom chorus and then reappears at the end to sing a reprise of that song. Magenta is a domestic from the planet Transsexual, in the galaxy Transylvania. Her job is simple: keep the castle clean and prepare all meals. Magenta is fond of her brother Riff Raff and can be seen laughing at the other's misery. She is close friends with Columbia. Magenta is not afraid to put her foot down to get her point across and will be pushy or rude to get what she wants.

Brad: Male, 18-35 (Range: Bari-Tenor, Bb2-G4) Quirky and overly optimistic. An All-American man who proposes to his girlfriend, Janet Weiss. However, on the way to meet his old friend and science teacher, Dr. Scott, Brad Majors ends up with a flat tire on his car. He soon finds himself at the mercy of Dr. Frank N Furter and his servants and ends up confused over his sexuality after the events in the castle.

Janet: Female, 18-35 (Range: Mezzo-Soprano Belt, A3-Eb5) Good, innocent girl madly in love with Brad. She always seems to be frightened of something. She keeps losing more of her clothes throughout the story. Emotionally weak and caves into pressure easily. During her time in the castle, she has sex with both Frank N. Furter and Rocky...the latter prompting pure rage from the former. In the end, she's also confused about what has occurred but also realizes the benefits of living a sexually active life.

Narrator: Male, Age Flexible (Non-Singing Role) Follows our two heroes through the story by narrating directly to the audience.

Riff Raff: Male, Age Flexible (Range: High Rock Tenor, D3-B4) Frank's butler, Riff Raff, is a shady character who seems up to something. In the end, he kills Frank, Rocky, and Columbia before he and his sister Magenta return to their home planet of Transsexual, Transylvania.

Columbia: Female, Age Flexible (Range: Mezzo-Soprano Belt, E4-E5) One of Frank’s servants. A groupie who is both Frank's and Eddie's ex-girlfriend. She starts as being extremely loyal to Frank. However, she quickly realizes that he's simply using her and turns on him. In the end, she's killed by Riff Raff. Tap Dancing skills are an asset.

Frank ’N’ Furter: Male Transvestite, 25-45 (Range: Baritone, D3-G4) (This Role is CAST) Master of the castle and seduction. Welcomes Janet and Brad with open arms. Frank is a Mad Scientist bent on creating the "perfect man," he succeeds by creating Rocky. He's something of the antagonist, causing all sorts of trouble for Brad and Janet. In the end, he's killed by Riff Raff.

Rocky: Male 18-35, Very Fit (Range: Tenor, A3-G4) Frank's beloved creation, Rocky, is supposed to be the "perfect man." However, things don't go well when Janet seduces him, causing Frank to become jealous. In the end, he's killed by Riff Raff while mourning Frank's loss and trying to escape.

Eddie/Dr.Scott: Any Gender, Age Flexible (Range: Baritone, E3-F#4) A former delivery boy who was Columbia's ex-boyfriend. Half of his brain was used to create Rocky. After escaping from the freezer (and singing a song), Frank promptly kills Eddie. Dr. Scott is Brad’s former science teacher and close friend. He ends up at the castle while looking for his nephew, Eddie.

Phantoms - Any Genders (Three will be cast): Dynamic characters within the production that help tell the story. Vocal expectations include a lot of easy harmony singing and some choral work. The Phantoms should be great dancers. Select ensemble members will be cast as understudies for Frank, Riff Raff, Magenta, Janet, Brad, Columbia, and Eddie/Dr.Scott.

DURATION

Sep 23, 2024 - Nov 10, 2024

SALARY

$300.00 – $650.00 per week
